summary: I'm trying to prepare myself to massive Sansa hatred with leaks coming yikes
question: I'm trying to prepare myself to massive Sansa hatred with leaks coming yikes
answer: Frikidoctor is a Dany stan (she has so many fans in Spain), I expect him to twist facts despite evidence that contradict him like he did a certain leak (Emilia was never on location but he insisted the scene involved Dany). I just want the bare facts and I’ll ignore his speculations

summary: Randyll Tarly in the show is an abusive prick though not as bad as his book version. However Sam doesn’t hate him, in fact he...
body: Randyll Tarly in the show is an abusive prick though not as bad as his book version. However Sam doesn’t hate him, in fact he actually tries to live up to his father’s expectations (to the point of frustrating Sam’s book fans), see the scene when he leaves the Citadel. I doubt he is going to react to his father’s death with joy, it might not be grief or anger but Sam won’t be happy. Dany can’t use his father’s abusive tendencies as an excuse like her stans claim because she wouldn’t know and Sam never asked her to burn his father alive.

summary: If any of you were bothered to know, my first Jonerys fic is making a comeback after I upload chapter 3 of ‘A Dragon Will Take...
body:
‘The Hitman and The Dragon’

If any of you were bothered to know, my first Jonerys fic is making a comeback after I upload chapter 3 of ‘A Dragon Will Take Us Home’.

It’s a Hitman Jon Snow that was contracted by Rhaegar to guard his younger sister, Daenerys, after she refuses to take the terrorist cell threat seriously. (R + L does not equal J)

Want to know the kicker? It’s set in the world of John Wick after the events of John Wick 2.

Here’s an upcoming snippet that will eventually be published.


“

Both bodyguard and ward sat across from one another, neither wanting to disrupt the peaceful dinner they were having, inside the restaurant’s isolated room.

[Hidden Dialogue between Jon and Daenerys ;) ]

Jon couldn’t help but stare at her, taking every perfect imperfection as she laughed into her wine filled glass. Her red lipstick accentuating her pale features and contrasting beautifully with her bright smile.

They made eye contact with one another and for a brief moment, Jon thought he could stay here forever.

No words were exchanged between them. Only the soft music of jazz played over the room as grey eyes stared into violet. It was slight, but the two souls inside the vacant room leaned over their respective table and toward one another.

However, it was not meant to be. A buzz filled the intercom, signaling that the room was prepared to be entered by a third personage.

Daenerys whipped her head to the mirror paned sliding door before turning to him with worry filled eyes.

“Are you expecting someone?”

Jon shook his head as he kept his eyes trained on the door.

“No ma’am” he assured her. “Please, take cover behind me”

Jon reached for the handgun placed behind his trousers and kept it aimed at the darkened doorway across from him.

The doors slid open and a lone and tall figure stepped forward and towards them.

“Stay right there” Jon ordered.

However, the figure kept striding slowly and forward.

Jon was not wearing his protective outfit but felt confident nonetheless. His gun ready and positioned, he was not bound to lose the upper hand anytime soon.

Still, the figure did not stutter in his step.

Jon cocked back the hammer of his pistol. Yet, the man strode one last stride forward. It wasn’t until the figure stepped into the fluorescence of the light that Jon felt his heart stop and let his arm drop below his elbows.

“Mis-Mister Wick?” Jon whispered out with a shaky voice.

Daenerys looked at him with confusion. She clearly caught on to the detail that Jon had previously known the man in front of them.

The man known as “Mr. Wick” stepped forward to them once again, but Jon quickly raised his gun and placed it to the heart of the man in front of him.

“Mr. Wick” Jon breathed out, “are you here to kill my ward?”

He heard a sharp intake of breath behind him. Jon could only imagine the fear coursing through the princess’ body. If only she could imagine the sundry of emotions coursing within his own.

John Wick gave a small smirk as he felt the gun shaking against his chest, being reminded of the former nervous persona of his former student.

[End Future Snippet]

blog.description:
librisognierealta.it è il mio blog.
Ho sempre sentito il bisogno di averne uno, ma non avevo mai trovato un argomento che mi spingesse a continuare a scrivere, finché non ho abbracciato la mia natura ossessia-compulsiva e assolutamente pignola! Da questo è nato il mio blog di recensioni e scleri di vario genere: Libri, Sogni e Realtà.

title: Curiosità: Game of Thrones - Braavos
body:
Curiosità: Game of Thrones - Braavos Nel quinto e nel quarto libro de Le Cronache del Ghiaccio e del Fuoco, mentre Arya si trova a Braavos si scoprono alcune storie interessanti sulla città. Cliccate sul link per scoprirne di più ;)


Curiosità – Game of Thrones: Braavos

Durante la permanenza di Arya a Braavos e, in particolare, nella Casa del Bianco e del Nero, veniamo a conoscenza di alcune informazioni su questa città.

Il primo Uomo senza Volto

L’Uomo Gentile racconta ad Arya la storia del primo Uomo senza volto.

Gli Uomini senza faccia sono nati tra le nebbie di Braavos, ma prima si erano insediati a Valyria, tra i poveri…

View On WordPress

summary: I was rewatching GoT, and I noticed that Sansa stopped being mad at her dad fairly early on. When they were at the tourney and...
question: I was rewatching GoT, and I noticed that Sansa stopped being mad at her dad fairly early on. When they were at the tourney and Ser Loras gave her the rose, Sansa latches onto Ned's arm almost instinctively asking him to not let The Mountain hurt Ser Loras. I thought that was adorable. When your young, you always think your parents are always the heroes who can help when you need them to. Even when she felt he let her down with Lady, she still reached out to him and took comfort in him.
answer: She does that in the book too. It is adorable even though the show didn’t care to examine why she was so angry at Ned. They would rather make her look bratty than someone who felt betrayed by her father

reblog.comment: She does that in the book too. It is adorable even though the show didn’t care to examine why she was so angry at Ned. They would rather make her look bratty than someone who felt betrayed by her father

trail.content_raw: She does that in the book too. It is adorable even though the show didn’t care to examine why she was so angry at Ned. They would rather make her look bratty than someone who felt betrayed by her father
trail.content: She does that in the book too. It is adorable even though the show didn’t care to examine why she was so angry at Ned. They would rather make her look bratty than someone who felt betrayed by her father

blog.name: reddragon1995
blog.title: Jonerys Snowstorm Of House Stargaryen
blog.description: HE LOVED HER AND SHE LOVED HIM

body:
A thought

When the Game of Thrones cast members say they didn’t see something coming: maybe it’s because they’re not as obsessed with picking apart every line of dialogue, every shot, every costume detail, every note of the score as we are. Like, they learn their lines and don’t even read the rest of the script, and if they actually watch an episode it’s probably not more than once. Of course they’re shocked. And on top of that they have to build hype.

reblog.comment:

Like, they learn their lines and don’t even read the rest of the script, and if they actually watch an episode it’s probably not more than once. Of course they’re shocked. And on top of that they have to build hype.

Like, they learn their lines and don’t even read the rest of the script, and if they actually watch an episode it’s probably not more than once. Of course they’re shocked. And on top of that they have to build hype.
trail.content:
A thought

When the Game of Thrones cast members say they didn’t see something coming: maybe it’s because they’re not as obsessed with picking apart every line of dialogue, every shot, every costume detail, every note of the score as we are. Like, they learn their lines and don’t even read the rest of the script, and if they actually watch an episode it’s probably not more than once. Of course they’re shocked. And on top of that they have to build hype.
